snippet: A chief executive’s political leanings may significantly influence whom workers donate to and choose at the polls, a study found.
abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin DealBook column reports on academic study finding power of chief executives over politics of their employees is stunning and potentially disturbing; says political preferences of CEOs are among biggest factors influencing both campaign contributions and electoral choices of workers; presidential election of 2016, however, appears to be topic most executives are shying away from, most likely due to nasty volatility of discourse that has emerged over course of campaign cycle.

headline.main: Whom to Vote For? Employees Tend to Follow Their Leader
headline.print_headline: In Politics, Workers Follow Boss’s Lead

snippet: Apple is expected to unveil the latest model on Wednesday, but if it is indeed missing this basic feature, devotees may be left disenchanted.
abstract: Apple's latest iPhone, about to be revealed to public in San Francisco, is thinner than previous model, slightly faster and equipped with premium cameras on Plus model; rumor mill offer fairly well-substantiated claim that new iPhone, in completely wireless feature twist, lacks headphone jack.

headline.main: Will the New Apple iPhone Have a Headphone Jack? Rumormongers Say It Won’t
headline.print_headline: It’s Faster, Has No Earphone Jack, and That Won’t Surprise Anyone

snippet: When Apple shows off its latest iPhone on Wednesday, it will answer a question it hasn't had to address in years: "What's it putting in the box?" (Besides the iPhone itself, that is.)

headline.main: Can Apple Make Listening Easy Without a Headphone Jack?
headline.print_headline: Can Apple Make Listening Easy Without a Headphone Jack?

snippet: Judging by the volume of online chatter, there's a lot less buzz in China ahead of this week's expected launch of the new Apple Inc iPhone, and people on the street say they're more likely to "wait and see" what the latest device offers than rush ...

headline.main: China's Online Chatter Muted Ahead of Apple iPhone 7 Launch
headline.print_headline: China's Online Chatter Muted Ahead of Apple iPhone 7 Launch

snippet: In its rush to beat rival products to market, notably Apple's new iPhone, Samsung Electronics has accelerated new phone launch cycles, but its haste is raising concerns that it fell short on quality testing.

headline.main: Samsung Trips on Quality Control in Rush to Pip Apple
headline.print_headline: Samsung Trips on Quality Control in Rush to Pip Apple

snippet: It turns out some wealthy companies are just like some wealthy hedge fund managers: They're taxed at far lower rates than nearly everyone else.

headline.main: Low Taxes at Dozens of Firms in Spotlight After Apple Ruling
headline.print_headline: Low Taxes at Dozens of Firms in Spotlight After Apple Ruling

snippet: Giuseppe González runs his bar his way.
abstract: Giuseppe Gonzalez, co-owner of bar Suffolk Arms on Lower East Side, offers recipe for Horse Apple cocktail.

headline.main: Timeless Cocktails on the Lower East Side

snippet: Fighting tax avoidance should be a cornerstone of a push by EU authorities for greater equality as they seek a response to a rise in populism across the continent, the head of euro zone finance ministers said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Tax Avoidance Must Be Targeted in EU Equality Push: Eurogroup Head
headline.print_headline: Tax Avoidance Must Be Targeted in EU Equality Push: Eurogroup Head
